page.title: 16SURVEY OF QUEEN ADELAIDE (i)
page.content: Queen Adelaide is a settlement of 80 houses,one church,now also a house, a post office,a garage and a village hall.They are built on either side of the Ely_Prickwillow Road which is crossed by three railway lines with manually operated crossing gates. The houses are brick with slate or corrugated iron roofs.The oldest house is 18th Century.150 people live in Adelaide,including 15 children of school age and 12 under 5 years.The children are taken by school bus to St.Etheldreda's Infant School(5-7) St.Mary's Junior School(7-11) and to the City of Ely College(11-18).Only 4 people who live in Adelaide actually work there:the postman and his wife who runs the postoffice,a farmer and and a fibre-glass boat builder.
